args: meilleurs offres pc portable 14 pouces 32Go RAM livrable en Belgique mai 2024

content.text:
Pour ceux qui recherchent un bureau vraiment portable, le X1 Carbon est exactement ce que le médecin a prescrit. Léger et ultraportable, ce PC a un faible encombrement et une longue durée de vie de la batterie. Il est conçu pour fonctionner n’importe où.

D’accord, peut-être que vous dirigez une petite entreprise. L’ordinateur portable X1 Carbon est l’un des meilleurs ordinateurs professionnels pour les petites entreprises. Il fonctionne gros et fonctionne comme le bourreau de travail dont vous avez besoin pour faire le travail tous les jours, à des prix qui ne vous empêcheront pas de dormir la nuit.

Les principales caractéristiques de l’ordinateur portable ThinkPad X1 Carbon

Les ordinateurs portables ThinkPad de Lenovo ont la réputation de longue date d’être parmi les plus fiables et les plus durables du marché. Le ThinkPad X1 Carbon ne fait pas exception, recueillant des éloges pour sa qualité de construction robuste, ses fonctionnalités haut de gamme et ses excellentes performances. C’est aussi l’un des ThinkPad les plus légers à un peu moins de trois livres, ce qui le rend idéal pour les utilisateurs professionnels qui voyagent fréquemment.

•            L’écran :

L’écran Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon mesure 14 pouces et affiche 900 x 1600 avec un écran HDR vibrant. Il a une excellente fluidité et réactivité et une excellente résolution d’écran pour le travail et l’utilisation

•            Son et caméra :

La caméra est livrée avec une résolution progressive 720, et le son dans l’appareil est excellent.

•            La durée de vie de la batterie 

Avec sa longue durée de vie de la batterie allant jusqu’à 14 heures sur une charge de signal ainsi que ses capacités de charge rapide, le ThinkPad X1 Carbon est toujours prêt à fonctionner quand vous l’êtes.

•            Conçu pour des performances fiables

Mince et élégant et pesant moins de 2,5 lb, le ThinkPad X1 Carbon est un 【296†ordinateur portable professionnel】 de 14 pouces doté de processeurs Intel® Core™ i7 de 10e génération et d’une  autonomie allant jusqu’à 19,5 heures. Assez de puissance sous le capot pour vous aider à passer à la vitesse supérieure. Si votre puissance s’épuise de manière inattendue, nous sommes là pour vous avec la technologie Rapid Charge. Il charge votre PC jusqu’à 80% en seulement une heure.

Le X1 Carbon dispose d’options d’affichage 4k vibrantes qui offrent une résolution claire et nette, que vous regardiez des feuilles de calcul ou des planches de photos, ainsi qu’un clavier rétroéclairé confortable pour les longues nuits de travail en basse lumière.

X1 Connectivité carbone

Le X1 Carbon fonctionne sur un système d’exploitation Windows 10 Pro et est équipé d’options SSD ultra-rapides  pour un démarrage rapide n’importe où. La facilité de connectivité et la fonctionnalité Wifi 6 de ce PC de renommée mondiale font vraiment du X1 Carbon le bureau en déplacement, que vous travailliez à domicile en parcourant de pièce en pièce, au bureau ou en voyage d’affaires.

Il comprend également une sélection généreuse de ports, notamment Thunderbolt 3, HDMI et USB Type-C. Et pour les utilisateurs soucieux de la sécurité, le X1 Carbon comprend un lecteur d’empreintes digitales et une caméra infrarouge en option.

Toutes ces caractéristiques font du ThinkPad X1 Carbon un excellent choix pour quiconque est sur le marché pour un nouvel ordinateur portable.

•            Préoccupé par la confidentialité et la sécurité?

Ne le soyez pas. Vous avez un peu d’intimité avec Thinkshutter, un couvercle coulissant intégré sur la caméra frontale et un lecteur d’empreintes digitales qui contrecarre le piratage biométrique avec anti-usurpation d’identité pour sécuriser votre travail.

Où pouvez-vous utiliser un ordinateur portable ThinkPad X1 Carbon ?

Avec sa longue durée de vie de la batterie allant jusqu’à 14 heures sur une charge de signal ainsi que ses capacités de charge rapide, le ThinkPad X1 Carbon est toujours prêt à fonctionner quand vous l’êtes.

•            Conçu pour des performances fiables

Mince et élégant et pesant moins de 2,5 lb, le ThinkPad X1 Carbon est un 【296†ordinateur portable professionnel】 de 14 pouces doté de processeurs Intel® Core™ i7 de 10e génération et d’une  autonomie allant jusqu’à 19,5 heures. X1 Connectivité carbone

Il comprend également une sélection généreuse de ports, notamment Thunderbolt 3, HDMI et USB Type-C. Et pour les utilisateurs soucieux de la sécurité, le X1 Carbon comprend un lecteur d’empreintes digitales et une caméra infrarouge en option.

Toutes ces caractéristiques font du ThinkPad X1 Carbon un excellent choix pour quiconque est sur le marché pour un nouvel ordinateur portable.

content_references.snippet:
Pour ceux qui recherchent un bureau vraiment portable, le X1 Carbon est exactement ce que le médecin a prescrit. Léger et ultraportable, ce PC a un faible encombrement et une longue durée de vie de la batterie. Il est conçu pour fonctionner n’importe où.

D’accord, peut-être que vous dirigez une petite entreprise. L’ordinateur portable X1 Carbon est l’un des meilleurs ordinateurs professionnels pour les petites entreprises. Il fonctionne gros et fonctionne comme le bourreau de travail dont vous avez besoin pour faire le travail tous les jours, à des prix qui ne vous empêcheront pas de dormir la nuit.

Les principales caractéristiques de l’ordinateur portable ThinkPad X1 Carbon

Les ordinateurs portables ThinkPad de Lenovo ont la réputation de longue date d’être parmi les plus fiables et les plus durables du marché. Le ThinkPad X1 Carbon ne fait pas exception, recueillant des éloges pour sa qualité de construction robuste, ses fonctionnalités haut de gamme et ses excellentes performances. C’est aussi l’un des ThinkPad les plus légers à un peu moins de trois livres, ce qui le rend idéal pour les utilisateurs professionnels qui voyagent fréquemment.

•            L’écran :

L’écran Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon mesure 14 pouces et affiche 900 x 1600 avec un écran HDR vibrant. Il a une excellente fluidité et réactivité et une excellente résolution d’écran pour le travail et l’utilisation

•            Son et caméra :

La caméra est livrée avec une résolution progressive 720, et le son dans l’appareil est excellent.

•            La durée de vie de la batterie 

Avec sa longue durée de vie de la batterie allant jusqu’à 14 heures sur une charge de signal ainsi que ses capacités de charge rapide, le ThinkPad X1 Carbon est toujours prêt à fonctionner quand vous l’êtes.

•            Conçu pour des performances fiables

Mince et élégant et pesant moins de 2,5 lb, le ThinkPad X1 Carbon est un 【296†ordinateur portable professionnel】 de 14 pouces doté de processeurs Intel® Core™ i7 de 10e génération et d’une  autonomie allant jusqu’à 19,5 heures. Assez de puissance sous le capot pour vous aider à passer à la vitesse supérieure. Si votre puissance s’épuise de manière inattendue, nous sommes là pour vous avec la technologie Rapid Charge. Il charge votre PC jusqu’à 80% en seulement une heure.

Le X1 Carbon dispose d’options d’affichage 4k vibrantes qui offrent une résolution claire et nette, que vous regardiez des feuilles de calcul ou des planches de photos, ainsi qu’un clavier rétroéclairé confortable pour les longues nuits de travail en basse lumière.

X1 Connectivité carbone

Le X1 Carbon fonctionne sur un système d’exploitation Windows 10 Pro et est équipé d’options SSD ultra-rapides  pour un démarrage rapide n’importe où. La facilité de connectivité et la fonctionnalité Wifi 6 de ce PC de renommée mondiale font vraiment du X1 Carbon le bureau en déplacement, que vous travailliez à domicile en parcourant de pièce en pièce, au bureau ou en voyage d’affaires.

Il comprend également une sélection généreuse de ports, notamment Thunderbolt 3, HDMI et USB Type-C. Et pour les utilisateurs soucieux de la sécurité, le X1 Carbon comprend un lecteur d’empreintes digitales et une caméra infrarouge en option.

Toutes ces caractéristiques font du ThinkPad X1 Carbon un excellent choix pour quiconque est sur le marché pour un nouvel ordinateur portable.

•            Préoccupé par la confidentialité et la sécurité?

parts: J'aime beaucoup les Thinkpad pour en avoir déjà utilisé plusieurs. Et je pense que généralement il sagit d'une gamme robuste et fiable qui a de bons avis. Mais le modèle que tu me propose dispose-t-il d'une bonne carte graphique ?

Le Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon Gen 12 n'est pas spécifiquement conçu pour des tâches graphiques intensives, car il n'a pas de carte graphique dédiée puissante. Il utilise généralement des graphiques intégrés Intel Iris Xe, qui sont suffisants pour les tâches professionnelles courantes mais pas idéaux pour des travaux exigeants en graphisme ou en gaming.

Si vous avez besoin d'une carte graphique dédiée pour des tâches plus lourdes, vous pourriez envisager un modèle de la gamme ThinkPad P, comme le ThinkPad P14s, qui offre des options avec des cartes graphiques dédiées Nvidia Quadro.

Pour des performances graphiques élevées dans un format 14 pouces, le **ThinkPad P14s** pourrait être une meilleure option :
- **Specs**: Intel Core i7, 32GB RAM, Nvidia Quadro T500, 1TB SSD.
- **Prix**: Vérifiez les disponibilités et les prix spécifiques pour la Belgique.

Cette gamme offre une excellente combinaison de robustesse, de performances et de capacités graphiques dédiées pour les professionnels.
Pourrais-tu me donner le numéro de modèle spécifiques pour ce ThinkPad p14s qui dispose de ces specifications? Ou le trouver des sites pour l'acheter stp ?

- **Processeur** : Intel Core i7-1185G7

- **Stockage** : 1TB SSD

* 【0†Back to the top ⤴】

## Zephyrus G14 review: Competition

[Image 22: Image of the ASUS ROG Zephyrus G14 (2024) gaming laptop.]

This is by far my favorite 14-inch gaming laptop, and one of my favorite 14-inch Windows laptops, period. (Image credit: Windows Central | Zachary Boddy)

Making a worthwhile 14-inch gaming laptop is actually a monumental endeavor, and only a few companies have really pulled it off. One of the biggest alternatives to the ASUS ROG Zephyrus G14 (2024) is the 【54†Razer Blade 14 (2024)】; that laptop is even more premium in its design and construction than the Zephyrus G14 and boasts a more impressive display to boot. It's simply not as capable even with the same internals, though you'll be paying a whole lot more, and you'll be accepting a downgrade in the keyboard and speakers departments.

The Alienware x14 R2 is a more reasonable competitor, coming closer in price to the Zephyrus G14 with an attractive design, solid performance, and respectable endurance. The Zephyrus G14 is more up-to-date, however, and is overall a more refined and premium laptop. If you don't need a ton of graphical power, the 【61†Dell XPS 14 (9440)】 is a properly powerful ultrabook with a futuristic, hyper-premium design. It's not as competent when gaming, and it's awfully expensive, but it's still one of the best Windows laptops on the market.

  * Recommended gaming headset: Razer BlackShark V2 Pro (2023) for 【62†$199.99 at Best Buy†shop-links.co】
  * Recommended gaming mouse: Razer Cobra Pro for 【63†$129.99 at Best Buy†shop-links.co】

Honestly, though, one of the most compelling options in this space is actually the ASUS ROG Zephyrus G14 (2023). It's bigger, heavier, less refined, and premium, and it doesn't last as long away from the charger. It's also just as powerful (if not more so when gaming) than the newer version, and you should be able to pick it up with an enticing discount now that the 2024 model is available. That laptop is still a fantastic machine.

content.text:
* 【27†More #MADEWITHBLADE stories】

## 14” QHD+ 240 Hz Display

### Edge-to-Edge Quality and Clarity

Calman Verified for pro-grade color accuracy and competition-ready with a 240 Hz refresh rate, enjoy vivid colors and the smoothest, most immersive visuals on the fast IPS-grade display.

  * ### Calman

Verified

  * ### 2560 x 1600

Resolution

  * ### < 3 ms

Response Time

  * ### 100% DCI-P3

Color Gamut

[Image 24]

## CALMAN VERIFIED

### Eye-Catching Calibration

Calibrated by the color-science leaders at Portrait Displays to be perfect for creators and gamers right out-of-the-box, each display is individually adjusted for color accuracy and consistency so you can play, consume, or create with confidence.

【28†Learn More > 】 

  * [Image 25: calman VERIFIED logo] 

[Image 26: Calman Verified Full Color] [Image 27: Calman Verified Desaturated] 

## EXPANDABLE DDR5 MEMORY

### Do More. Do It Faster.

Equipped with up to 32 GB of 5600 MHz DDR5 memory, the laptop’s dual memory slots can also support up to 96 GB of memory for power users and future‑proofers.

[Image 28]

## OPTIMIZED VAPOR CHAMBER COOLING

### Thin. Cool. Efficient.

Refined over generations, the vapor chamber cooling solution features the world’s thinnest exhaust fins^{3} paired with a dual-fan solution and a wide surface area coverage to provide better cooling than ever before while maintaining the Blade’s signature low-profile design. Complete with server grade thermal interface material to better exchange heat between core components, the Blade 14 pushes processor performance to the limits while staying cool under pressure.

  * 59%   
Surface Area Coverage

  * Dual-Fan   
Exhaust

  * 0.05 mm   
Exhaust Fins

[Image 29]

## CONSTANTLY CONNECTED

### Compact and Versatile

Upgraded to Wi-Fi 7 and Bluetooth 5.4, enjoy faster downloads and a more stable connection when gaming or conferencing. Equipped with dual USB4 Type-C ports, seamlessly connect key accessories to your setup such as a Thunderbolt™ docking station. From mobile livestreams and multi-monitor setups, do it all without the need for a dongle or adapter.

[Image 30: Product view with parts labeled 1, 3, 2, 4, 6, 7, 2, 3, 5.] 

  * 1. Full HD Webcam with Privacy Shutter   
2. USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type‑A   
3. USB4 Type-C   
*Not shown: Wi-Fi 7 / BT5.4

  * 4. HDMI 2.1   
5. 3.5 mm Combo Audio Jack   
6. Kensington Lock   
7. Power Port

## SENSATIONAL EXPERIENCES

  * [Image 31: Razer Chroma RGB Logo] 

### Per-key Razer Chroma™ RGB

Personalize the keyboard’s lighting from 16.8 million colours and a variety of effects. Experience greater immersion as it reacts dynamically with your favorite Chroma-integrated games.   

【29†Learn More >】

  * [Image 32: THX® Logo] 

### THX® Spatial Audio

Enjoy a cinematic audio experience enhanced by our virtual 7.1 surround sound. Select from a variety of pre-tuned profiles to best suit your listening needs or create your own EQ profile.   

【30†Learn More >】

  * [Image 33] 

### Microsoft Precision Touchpad

A massive, clickable glass touchpad with Microsoft Precision Driver support means smooth and precise control, including a range of gestures for expanded navigation.

## OTHER FEATURES

  * [Image 34] 

### Microsoft Pluton^{4}

Designed by Microsoft and built by silicon partners, Pluton technology is integrated Directly into the PC’s processor, hardening new Windows 11 devices with ongoing protection for identities, data, and applications.

  * [Image 35: Razer Synapse 3 Logo] 

### Advanced Control System

Take full control with Razer Synapse, from customizing lighting, managing profiles, adjusting fans, and even stepping up graphics performance in Gaming Mode.

  * [Image 36] 

### Windows Hello

Using facial recognition or a PIN, Windows Hello is a fast, secure, and password-less way to unlock your Windows devices.

## EASIER TO PLAY

Play the latest games with graphics that rival reality. Play with players on console. Play with the peripherals that you love. When it comes to playing your way, Windows 11 makes it happen.

【31†Learn More > 】 

  * 【31† 】 

[Image 37: EASIER TO PLAY] 

## GO ALL OUT WITH THESE ACCESSORIES

  * [Image 38] 

### Razer Skins

Protect and customize your device with premium designs to stand out or blend in.   

【32†Learn More >】

  * [Image 39] 

### Thunderbolt™ 4 Dock Chroma

Unlock maximum connectivity with a universal Thunderbolt™ 4 dock fitted with 10 ports to support all your devices.   

【33†Learn More >】

  * [Image 40] 

### Razer USB-C 130W GaN Charger

Capable of charging up to 4 devices simultaneously, in a form factor small enough to fit in your pocket.   

【34†Learn More >】

parts:
Pour un laptop avec DDR5 qui correspond à tes besoins, voici quelques options intéressantes disponibles en Belgique :

1. **Razer Blade 14 (2024)**
   - **Écran**: 14 pouces, QHD+ (2560 x 1600), 240 Hz
   - **RAM**: 32 Go DDR5 (5600 MHz)
   - **Processeur**: AMD Ryzen 9 7940HS
   - **Carte Graphique**: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070
   - **Stockage**: 1 To SSD
   - **Prix**: Environ 2 699,99 €
   - **Lien**: [Razer](https://www.razer.com/gaming-laptops/razer-blade-14)【32†source】.

2. **ASUS ROG Zephyrus G14 (2024)**
   - **Écran**: 14 pouces, OLED 3K (2880 x 1800), 120 Hz
   - **RAM**: 32 Go LPDDR5X
   - **Processeur**: AMD Ryzen 9 8945HS
   - **Carte Graphique**: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070
   - **Stockage**: 1 To SSD
   - **Prix**: Environ 2 699,99 €
   - **Lien**: [Best Buy](https://www.bestbuy.com/site/asus-rog-zephyrus-g14)【33†source】【34†source】.

Ces modèles offrent des performances élevées, avec des configurations adaptées à des tâches intensives en termes de traitement et de graphisme. Cependant, ils dépassent le budget initial de 1500 € que tu avais mentionné.

Si tu es prêt à considérer une augmentation de budget, ces options sont parmi les meilleures disponibles actuellement. Sinon, pour rester dans un budget plus serré tout en ayant de la DDR5, il pourrait être nécessaire de faire quelques compromis sur certaines spécifications ou d'examiner des modèles plus anciens ou reconditionnés.

N'hésite pas à vérifier la disponibilité et les options de livraison pour la Belgique sur les sites des fabricants ou des détaillants mentionnés.

metadata.title: The Ultimate 14-Inch Laptop for Gamers and Creators: Razer Blade 14 | Razer United States
metadata.text:
* 【27†More #MADEWITHBLADE stories】

## 14” QHD+ 240 Hz Display

### Edge-to-Edge Quality and Clarity

Calman Verified for pro-grade color accuracy and competition-ready with a 240 Hz refresh rate, enjoy vivid colors and the smoothest, most immersive visuals on the fast IPS-grade display.

  * ### Calman

Verified

  * ### 2560 x 1600

Resolution

  * ### < 3 ms

Response Time

  * ### 100% DCI-P3

Color Gamut

[Image 24]

## CALMAN VERIFIED

### Eye-Catching Calibration

Calibrated by the color-science leaders at Portrait Displays to be perfect for creators and gamers right out-of-the-box, each display is individually adjusted for color accuracy and consistency so you can play, consume, or create with confidence.

【28†Learn More > 】 

  * [Image 25: calman VERIFIED logo] 

[Image 26: Calman Verified Full Color] [Image 27: Calman Verified Desaturated] 

## EXPANDABLE DDR5 MEMORY

### Do More. Do It Faster.

Equipped with up to 32 GB of 5600 MHz DDR5 memory, the laptop’s dual memory slots can also support up to 96 GB of memory for power users and future‑proofers.

[Image 28]

## OPTIMIZED VAPOR CHAMBER COOLING

### Thin. Cool. Efficient.

Refined over generations, the vapor chamber cooling solution features the world’s thinnest exhaust fins^{3} paired with a dual-fan solution and a wide surface area coverage to provide better cooling than ever before while maintaining the Blade’s signature low-profile design. Complete with server grade thermal interface material to better exchange heat between core components, the Blade 14 pushes processor performance to the limits while staying cool under pressure.

  * 59%   
Surface Area Coverage

  * Dual-Fan   
Exhaust

  * 0.05 mm   
Exhaust Fins

[Image 29]

## CONSTANTLY CONNECTED

### Compact and Versatile

Upgraded to Wi-Fi 7 and Bluetooth 5.4, enjoy faster downloads and a more stable connection when gaming or conferencing. Equipped with dual USB4 Type-C ports, seamlessly connect key accessories to your setup such as a Thunderbolt™ docking station. From mobile livestreams and multi-monitor setups, do it all without the need for a dongle or adapter.

[Image 30: Product view with parts labeled 1, 3, 2, 4, 6, 7, 2, 3, 5.] 

  * 1. Full HD Webcam with Privacy Shutter   
2. USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type‑A   
3. USB4 Type-C   
*Not shown: Wi-Fi 7 / BT5.4

  * 4. HDMI 2.1   
5. 3.5 mm Combo Audio Jack   
6. Kensington Lock   
7. Power Port

## SENSATIONAL EXPERIENCES

  * [Image 31: Razer Chroma RGB Logo] 

### Per-key Razer Chroma™ RGB

Personalize the keyboard’s lighting from 16.8 million colours and a variety of effects. Experience greater immersion as it reacts dynamically with your favorite Chroma-integrated games.   

【29†Learn More >】

  * [Image 32: THX® Logo] 

### THX® Spatial Audio

Enjoy a cinematic audio experience enhanced by our virtual 7.1 surround sound. Select from a variety of pre-tuned profiles to best suit your listening needs or create your own EQ profile.   

【30†Learn More >】

  * [Image 33] 

### Microsoft Precision Touchpad

A massive, clickable glass touchpad with Microsoft Precision Driver support means smooth and precise control, including a range of gestures for expanded navigation.

## OTHER FEATURES

  * [Image 34] 

### Microsoft Pluton^{4}

Designed by Microsoft and built by silicon partners, Pluton technology is integrated Directly into the PC’s processor, hardening new Windows 11 devices with ongoing protection for identities, data, and applications.

  * [Image 35: Razer Synapse 3 Logo] 

### Advanced Control System

Take full control with Razer Synapse, from customizing lighting, managing profiles, adjusting fans, and even stepping up graphics performance in Gaming Mode.

  * [Image 36] 

### Windows Hello

Using facial recognition or a PIN, Windows Hello is a fast, secure, and password-less way to unlock your Windows devices.

## EASIER TO PLAY

Play the latest games with graphics that rival reality. Play with players on console. Play with the peripherals that you love. When it comes to playing your way, Windows 11 makes it happen.

【31†Learn More > 】 

  * 【31† 】 

[Image 37: EASIER TO PLAY] 

## GO ALL OUT WITH THESE ACCESSORIES

  * [Image 38] 

### Razer Skins

Protect and customize your device with premium designs to stand out or blend in.   

【32†Learn More >】

  * [Image 39] 

### Thunderbolt™ 4 Dock Chroma

Unlock maximum connectivity with a universal Thunderbolt™ 4 dock fitted with 10 ports to support all your devices.   

【33†Learn More >】

  * [Image 40] 

### Razer USB-C 130W GaN Charger

Capable of charging up to 4 devices simultaneously, in a form factor small enough to fit in your pocket.   

【34†Learn More >】

content_references.title: The Ultimate 14-Inch Laptop for Gamers and Creators: Razer Blade 14 | Razer United States
content_references.snippet:
* 【27†More #MADEWITHBLADE stories】

## 14” QHD+ 240 Hz Display

### Edge-to-Edge Quality and Clarity

Calman Verified for pro-grade color accuracy and competition-ready with a 240 Hz refresh rate, enjoy vivid colors and the smoothest, most immersive visuals on the fast IPS-grade display.

  * ### Calman

Verified

  * ### 2560 x 1600

Resolution

  * ### < 3 ms

Response Time

  * ### 100% DCI-P3

Color Gamut

[Image 24]

## CALMAN VERIFIED

### Eye-Catching Calibration

Calibrated by the color-science leaders at Portrait Displays to be perfect for creators and gamers right out-of-the-box, each display is individually adjusted for color accuracy and consistency so you can play, consume, or create with confidence.

【28†Learn More > 】 

  * [Image 25: calman VERIFIED logo] 

[Image 26: Calman Verified Full Color] [Image 27: Calman Verified Desaturated] 

## EXPANDABLE DDR5 MEMORY

### Do More. Do It Faster.

Equipped with up to 32 GB of 5600 MHz DDR5 memory, the laptop’s dual memory slots can also support up to 96 GB of memory for power users and future‑proofers.

[Image 28]

## OPTIMIZED VAPOR CHAMBER COOLING

### Thin. Cool. Efficient.

Refined over generations, the vapor chamber cooling solution features the world’s thinnest exhaust fins^{3} paired with a dual-fan solution and a wide surface area coverage to provide better cooling than ever before while maintaining the Blade’s signature low-profile design. Complete with server grade thermal interface material to better exchange heat between core components, the Blade 14 pushes processor performance to the limits while staying cool under pressure.

  * 59%   
Surface Area Coverage

  * Dual-Fan   
Exhaust

  * 0.05 mm   
Exhaust Fins

[Image 29]

## CONSTANTLY CONNECTED

### Compact and Versatile

Upgraded to Wi-Fi 7 and Bluetooth 5.4, enjoy faster downloads and a more stable connection when gaming or conferencing. Equipped with dual USB4 Type-C ports, seamlessly connect key accessories to your setup such as a Thunderbolt™ docking station. From mobile livestreams and multi-monitor setups, do it all without the need for a dongle or adapter.

[Image 30: Product view with parts labeled 1, 3, 2, 4, 6, 7, 2, 3, 5.] 

  * 1. Full HD Webcam with Privacy Shutter   
2. USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type‑A   
3. USB4 Type-C   
*Not shown: Wi-Fi 7 / BT5.4

  * 4. HDMI 2.1   
5. 3.5 mm Combo Audio Jack   
6. Kensington Lock   
7. Power Port

## SENSATIONAL EXPERIENCES

  * [Image 31: Razer Chroma RGB Logo] 

### Per-key Razer Chroma™ RGB

Personalize the keyboard’s lighting from 16.8 million colours and a variety of effects. Experience greater immersion as it reacts dynamically with your favorite Chroma-integrated games.   

【29†Learn More >】

  * [Image 32: THX® Logo] 

### THX® Spatial Audio

Enjoy a cinematic audio experience enhanced by our virtual 7.1 surround sound. Select from a variety of pre-tuned profiles to best suit your listening needs or create your own EQ profile.   

【30†Learn More >】

  * [Image 33] 

### Microsoft Precision Touchpad

A massive, clickable glass touchpad with Microsoft Precision Driver support means smooth and precise control, including a range of gestures for expanded navigation.

## OTHER FEATURES

  * [Image 34] 

### Microsoft Pluton^{4}

Designed by Microsoft and built by silicon partners, Pluton technology is integrated Directly into the PC’s processor, hardening new Windows 11 devices with ongoing protection for identities, data, and applications.

  * [Image 35: Razer Synapse 3 Logo] 

### Advanced Control System

Take full control with Razer Synapse, from customizing lighting, managing profiles, adjusting fans, and even stepping up graphics performance in Gaming Mode.

  * [Image 36] 

### Windows Hello

Using facial recognition or a PIN, Windows Hello is a fast, secure, and password-less way to unlock your Windows devices.

## EASIER TO PLAY

Play the latest games with graphics that rival reality. Play with players on console. Play with the peripherals that you love. When it comes to playing your way, Windows 11 makes it happen.

【31†Learn More > 】 

  * 【31† 】 

[Image 37: EASIER TO PLAY] 

## GO ALL OUT WITH THESE ACCESSORIES

  * [Image 38] 

### Razer Skins

Protect and customize your device with premium designs to stand out or blend in.   

【32†Learn More >】

  * [Image 39] 

### Thunderbolt™ 4 Dock Chroma

Unlock maximum connectivity with a universal Thunderbolt™ 4 dock fitted with 10 ports to support all your devices.   

【33†Learn More >】

  * [Image 40] 

### Razer USB-C 130W GaN Charger

Capable of charging up to 4 devices simultaneously, in a form factor small enough to fit in your pocket.   

【34†Learn More >】

parts:
En explorant les différentes configuration sur différents sites j'ai quand même du mal à trouver ce que je cherche. Que ce soit chez Dell, Lenovo, MSI, PC Spécialiste,...
Idéalement je souhaiterai vraiment un laptop assez compact, donc Idéalement une taille d'écran de 14 pouces. Mais étant assez puissant afin de faire de la modélisation 3D, du montage vidéo, de la programmation et des tests sur des modèles d'IA. Donc je suppose sans trop me tromper qu'il faudrait bien 32Go de RAM, une carte graphique dédiée. 500Go voir 1To de mémoire et un bon processeur. Mais j'ai l'impression qu'une telle configuration n'existe pas. Surtout à moins de 2000€. Pourrais-tu m'aider à trouver mon rêve stp ?

content.text:
If you want OLED, its display will leave much to be desired, but its ability to reproduce 81.3 percent of the DCI-P3 color gamut makes it colorful enough for most users. And, of course, Apple never disappoints when it comes to brightness, managing an average of 558 nits. This makes it easy to work on even the brightest days.

See our full 【57†M3 MacBook Pro review】.

### 【61†2. Asus Zenbook 14 OLED (Q425M)】

Affordable perfection

【61†Our expert review:】

#### Specifications 

CPU: Intel Core Ultra 7 155H 

GPU: Intel Iris Xe 

RAM: 16GB 

Storage: 1TB 

Display: 14-inch, 1800p 

Size: 12.3 x 8.67 x 0.59 inches 

Weight: 3 lbs 

Today's Best Deals

【41†View at Amazon†target.georiot.com】

【42†View at ASUS†www.awin1.com】

【43†View at Best Buy†shop-links.co】

#### Reasons to buy

+

Almost 16 hours of battery life!

+

Snappy performance

+

Quality audio

+

Smooth, comfortable keyboard

+

Secure webcam privacy shutter 

#### Reasons to avoid

-

Display could be brighter 

Buying a budget doesn't mean sacrificing a premium aesthetic or solid performance. In fact, for $800, you can snag the 【62†Asus】 【63†Zenbook】 14 OLED, a stylish laptop with 【64†Intel】 Meteor Lake performance, 16GB of RAM, and 1TB of storage.

Not every laptop has to achieve stratospheric levels of face-melting performance or the type of graphical prowess that could rival the latest game consoles. The Zenbook 14 OLED instead provides a decent platform with which you can handle considerable work.

Its battery life, in particular, is staggering. On the Laptop Mag battery test, which involves continuous web browsing over Wi-Fi at 150 nits, it lasted for 15 hours and 52 minutes. We typically recommend productivity laptops last between 9 and 10 hours, and for it to go above and beyond undoubtedly makes it one of the longest-lasting laptops you can buy right now. Even the【65† MacBook Air 13-inch M3】, which is more expensive, didn't last quite as long at 15 hours and 13 minutes.

On the Geekbench 6 overall performance test, the Zenbook 14 OLED managed a multi-core score of 12,707, which is phenomenal. Again, this is superior to the 【66†MacBook Air】 13-inch M3's 12,087, which is impressive considering it costs more. And when you consider the laptop's stunning OLED display, you won't believe your eyes. Beyond just the alluring inkiness of deep blacks, you can enjoy 79.8 percent DCI-P3 coverage. It does fine in brightness, but its 339 nits could be better.

See our full 【61†Asus Zenbook 14 OLED (Q425M)】.

There always has to be one machine out there touting the "MacBook killer" moniker, and our current best pick for that title in the 14-inch laptop category is the Acer Swift Go 14. It's packed to the gills with high-performance components and ticks off all Ultrabook requirements. Better still, it's affordable and houses one of the most vivid OLED displays we've encountered.

The Swift Go 14's incredible performance results from a 13th-generation Evo-certified 【68†Intel Core】 i7 processor, Intel Iris Xe graphics, and 16GB of RAM with 512GB of SSD storage to back it up. However, regardless of the top-notch tech housed inside, the Swift Go 14's dazzling 2.8K, 14-i

There always has to be one machine out there touting the "MacBook killer" moniker, and our current best pick for that title in the 14-inch laptop category is the Acer Swift Go 14. It's packed to the gills with high-performance components and ticks off all Ultrabook requirements. Better still, it's affordable and houses one of the most vivid OLED displays we've encountered.

The Swift Go 14's incredible performance results from a 13th-generation Evo-certified 【68†Intel Core】 i7 processor, Intel Iris Xe graphics, and 16GB of RAM with 512GB of SSD storage to back it up. However, regardless of the top-notch tech housed inside, the Swift Go 14's dazzling 2.8K, 14-i

content.text:
Its nearest competitors didn’t crack 300 nits. It’s fair to conclude, after almost 22 years in the market, that ASUS knows how to build a laptop for gaming. The manufacturer always decides whether to do a complete overhaul or when to do some changes and refine the product as a whole.

Performance Under Workload 

The ASUS ROG Strix Scar 15 Gaming laptop version is the first in the series to rock Intel’s latest 5.0-GHz, 12th Gen Core i9-12900H CPU with a whopping 32 GB RAM.

And thanks to the ASUS Command Center, this beast can be overclocked to a blazing 6 GHz. When it comes to multitasking it is sort of like a modern Ivan Drago.

We started streaming Runaways on Hulu when watching some of our favorite videos on YouTube about the Steven Universe hypothesis. We just kept opening tabs in Google Chrome from there, some running Slack, some running Twitch, until we got 35 tabs free.

Then We run Windows Protector and out of this thing, there was nary a hiccup. However, all of our tests didn’t automatically turn that strength into stellar performance.

For example, it kept its own but it did not blow the rivalry away. This unit on Geekbench 4 delivered 20,890 which measures overall performance. That beats the average 17,290 luxury gaming laptops but the Titan and Aorus produced 22,754 and 25,915, respectively, equipped with their own 8950HKs.

The Eon17-X reached 21,713, with its Intel Core i9-12900H CPU laptop. The ASUS ROG Strix Scar 15 paired up 65,000 names and addresses in 42 seconds during our Excel usability check, slipping past the typical 0:44 level. The Titan and Aorus X9 posted 0:34 and 0:31 quicker speeds, respectively.

## 2. MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop

【70† MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop: 16" QHD+ 16:10 120Hz... †www.amazon.com】 

  * Display: 16″ QHD+, 3840 x 2160, Anti-glare, 4K
  * Processor: Intel Core i9-11900H, 4.6GHz, 8 Cores
  * Graphics Card:  NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 8GB, GDDR6
  * RAM & Storage: 32GB DDR4, 2TB NVMe SSD
  * Operating System: Windows 10 Pro

【70†CHECK ON AMAZON†www.amazon.com】 

Pros

  * Solid Performance
  * Can be Used for Gaming
  * Portable Design
  * Built for Intensive Work 

Cons

  * Speakers are Average 
  * Starting Price is High 

Design

The MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop is made out of aluminum with a silver finish, good thing is that at least we don’t have to worry about it being made of plastic. However, when adding some weight to the center of the keyboard its lightweight produces some visible flex.

Also when you push the corners of the screen and area around the power button, the same flex happens. A security lock slot, two Type-A USB 3.1 ports an Ethernet port, and separate jack for headphones and microphones are included in the connectivity options of MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop gaming laptop.

You will find a display outputs for mini DisplayPort and HDMI, an external USB-A port, an AC adapter connector and a Thunderbolt 3 port on the right side of this gaming rig.

Display 

The MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop offers a 4K 3840 x 2160 resolution eye-friendly display, the screen is non-touch. Though as games do, productivity and innovation Applications will not going to exploit their high refresh rate.

All of the images look incredibly sharp on this display. backed by wide viewing angles and inky blacks set on pristine white backgrounds, the level of brightness and contrast is more than enough.

Even though the matte finish of the screen minimizes screen glare but at the same time, the colors look faded. Ultimately, for long work sessions, this screen will appear to be a good place. So overall the display of MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop is great especially if you are interested in playing triple AAA games. 

Performance Under Workload 

The MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop is as powerful as it comes in performance with the new 【71†Intel Core i9-11900H CPU†ark.intel.com】, 32 GB RAM, 2TB NVMe SSD, and 【72†Nvidia GeForce RTX 3060†www.nvidia.com】 graphics card.

Good thing is that this configuration is the same as compared to gaming laptops. This simply means for the vast majority of things as a content creator you can throw at it, this machine is capable enough to cope up well with them all as its name suggests.

This laptop easily edits a 4 K video without slowing down throughout the whole process during our test and it takes a matter of seconds to render the edited video at the tail end.

To be honest, that kind of performance level you only get from a pro-machine built for content creation and editing. So if you require a laptop for video editing and content creation then consider MSI P65 your best option under the budget of $2500.

【73† BUY NOW ON AMAZON†www.amazon.com】

The fanless design is totally silent, but it also means the M3 chip isn't actively cooled. That means yes, the chip will throttle for intense work like video editing and rendering. (In our testing, we found the 13-inch laptop throttled faster possibly because the 15-inch Air has more surface area to cool the chip). But for most tasks, like email, documents, and spreadsheets, you shouldn't have any worries.

#### Reasons to buy

M3 Max offers powerful performance

+

Long battery life

+

Great build quality

+

Excellent Mini-LED display 

#### Reasons to avoid

-

Memory and SSD upgrades are extremely pricey 

Apple's MacBook Pros on Apple Silicon haven't changed much in design, except now they come in Space Black. (And Space Black looks great!). Apple's latest changes are still on the inside, with its latest M3 Pro and M3 Max chips.  

We tested the 16-inch MacBook Pro with an M3 Max and were impressed by its battery life: 17 hours and 11 minutes on our battery test, even while powering a vivid Mini-LED screen. The chip is efficient.

This latest MacBook Pros retain the wide variety of ports, including HDMI and an SD card slot, that we loved last year, as well as a bright, vivid Mini-LED display.

While the design hasn't changed, that means you also get excellent speakers and a comfortable keyboard with full-size function keys. But it also means that there's still a notch in the display to hold the 1080p webcam, which some might find to be distracting.

For those who need more graphics power, you may want to step up to the M3 Max, goes up to 40 graphics cores. If you want more battery life, the 16-inch MacBook Pro has a larger battery (100 WHr vs the 14-incher MacBook Pro's 72.4 WHr), and endured.   

If you prefer a smaller screen, you may want to consider the 14-inch Macbook Pro, which also comes with your choice of M3 Pro or M3 Max. We haven't had the chance to test the new entry level MacBook Pro — a 14-incher with a regular M3 and fewer ports — but that one is expensive for the amount of RAM you get in it, and with upgrades benign so pricey, you may want to start with the more powerful options anyway.

Read: 【66†MacBook Pro (16-inch) Review】

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

Good price for high specs

【71†Our expert review:】

GPU: Intel Arc integrated Graphics 

Display: 14-inch, 2880 x 1800, 16:10, OLED touchscreen 

Weight: 2.82 pounds (1.28 kg)

Today's Best Deals

【72†View at Amazon†target.georiot.com】

【73†View at ASUS†www.awin1.com】

【74†View at Best Buy†shop-links.co】

#### Reasons to buy

+

Thin and light build

+

Good price for 32GB of RAM and 1TB of storage

+

Fast, bursty performance

+

Colorful screen 

#### Reasons to avoid

-

Throttled during stress testing

-

Mushy keyboard 

It's easy to impress us with a great screen or fast performance, and the Asus Zenbook 14 OLED delivers both. But where it really shows off is its price. You get an Intel Core Ultra 7 155H, 32GB of RAM and 1TB of storage for $1,299 as of this writing. Many other companies would charge you hundreds of dollars more.  

Beyond those specs, you get a light laptop at just 2.82 pounds (1.28 kg) that feels pretty sturdy, though the "ponder blue" metal body is a bit of a fingerprint magnet. 

We found that Asus' laptop offered fast, bursty performance, hitting a single-core score of 1,809 and a multi-core score of 10,962 on Geekbench 5. But when we stress tested the laptop with Cinebench, we found that the chip throttled in continuous testing. So the laptop is fine for bursts of speed, but not for long-term heavy workloads.

The keyboard is a bit mushy for our liking, but otherwise, you're getting pretty high level specs for that $1,299 price tag. Other laptop companies should take note on the pricing.

Read: 【71†Asus Zenbook 14 OLED (UX3405M) review】

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

parts:
Il semble que trouver un ordinateur portable de 14 pouces avec 32 Go de RAM, une carte graphique dédiée et un processeur puissant pour moins de 2000€ soit un défi, mais il y a quelques options qui pourraient correspondre à vos besoins.

### ASUS ZenBook 14 (UX3404VC-BB99T)
- **Écran**: 14 pouces OLED, 120Hz
- **Processeur**: Intel Core i9 13e génération
- **RAM**: 32 Go
- **Stockage**: 1 To SSD
- **Carte graphique**: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050
- **Prix**: Environ 1800€

Ce modèle est une excellente option avec un écran OLED haute résolution et une configuration puissante adaptée pour la modélisation 3D, le montage vidéo, et les tests de modèles IA【42†source】【43†source】.

### MSI Prestige 14
- **Écran**: 14 pouces UHD (4K)
- **Processeur**: Intel Core i7 12e génération
- **RAM**: 32 Go
- **Stockage**: 1 To SSD
- **Carte graphique**: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050
- **Prix**: Environ 2000€

Ce modèle est conçu pour les créateurs de contenu et les professionnels nécessitant une grande puissance de traitement et une bonne qualité graphique【41†source】.

### Lenovo ThinkPad P14s
- **Écran**: 14 pouces FHD
- **Processeur**: Intel Core i7 ou AMD Ryzen 7
- **RAM**: 32 Go
- **Stockage**: 1 To SSD
- **Carte graphique**: NVIDIA T500
- **Prix**: Variable, généralement autour de 1800-2000€

Le ThinkPad P14s est robuste et fiable, idéal pour un usage intensif tout en restant relativement compact【42†source】.

### Où les acheter
Vous pouvez trouver ces modèles sur des sites tels que Best Buy, Amazon, ou directement sur les sites des fabricants comme ASUS, MSI, et Lenovo. Assurez-vous de vérifier les options de livraison vers la Belgique et les politiques d'achat pour les ASBL.

Ces options devraient répondre à vos critères de compacité, puissance, et budget, tout en étant adaptées à vos besoins professionnels en modélisation 3D, montage vidéo, programmation, et tests de modèles d'IA.

metadata.title: Best Ultrabooks and Premium Laptops 2024 | Tom's Hardware
metadata.text:
The fanless design is totally silent, but it also means the M3 chip isn't actively cooled. That means yes, the chip will throttle for intense work like video editing and rendering. (In our testing, we found the 13-inch laptop throttled faster possibly because the 15-inch Air has more surface area to cool the chip). But for most tasks, like email, documents, and spreadsheets, you shouldn't have any worries.

Read: 【61†MacBook Air (M3) review】

* * *

[Image 10: Apple MacBook Pro 16 (Late 2023)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

### 【66†4. MacBook Pro (16-inch)】

A Powerful Mac Option

【66†Our expert review:】

【67†Average Amazon review:†target.georiot.com】

☆☆☆☆☆

#### Specifications 

CPU: Apple M3 Max (16-core)

GPU: 40-core (Apple M3 Max integrated)

Display: 16.2-inch Liquid Retina XDR display, 3,456 x 2,234, 120 Hz Pro Motion 

Weight: 4.8 pounds (2.16 kg)

Today's Best Deals

【68†View at Amazon†target.georiot.com】

【69†View at Best Buy†shop-links.co】

【70†View at Apple†apple.sjv.io】

#### Reasons to buy

+

M3 Max offers powerful performance

+

Long battery life

+

Great build quality

+

Excellent Mini-LED display 

#### Reasons to avoid

-

Memory and SSD upgrades are extremely pricey 

Apple's MacBook Pros on Apple Silicon haven't changed much in design, except now they come in Space Black. (And Space Black looks great!). Apple's latest changes are still on the inside, with its latest M3 Pro and M3 Max chips.  

We tested the 16-inch MacBook Pro with an M3 Max and were impressed by its battery life: 17 hours and 11 minutes on our battery test, even while powering a vivid Mini-LED screen. The chip is efficient.

This latest MacBook Pros retain the wide variety of ports, including HDMI and an SD card slot, that we loved last year, as well as a bright, vivid Mini-LED display.

While the design hasn't changed, that means you also get excellent speakers and a comfortable keyboard with full-size function keys. But it also means that there's still a notch in the display to hold the 1080p webcam, which some might find to be distracting.

For those who need more graphics power, you may want to step up to the M3 Max, goes up to 40 graphics cores. If you want more battery life, the 16-inch MacBook Pro has a larger battery (100 WHr vs the 14-incher MacBook Pro's 72.4 WHr), and endured.   

If you prefer a smaller screen, you may want to consider the 14-inch Macbook Pro, which also comes with your choice of M3 Pro or M3 Max. We haven't had the chance to test the new entry level MacBook Pro — a 14-incher with a regular M3 and fewer ports — but that one is expensive for the amount of RAM you get in it, and with upgrades benign so pricey, you may want to start with the more powerful options anyway.

Read: 【66†MacBook Pro (16-inch) Review】

[Image 11: Asus Zenbook 14 OLED]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

### 【71†5. Asus Zenbook 14 OLED】

Good price for high specs

【71†Our expert review:】

#### Specifications 

CPU: Intel Core Ultra 7 155H 

GPU: Intel Arc integrated Graphics 

Display: 14-inch, 2880 x 1800, 16:10, OLED touchscreen 

Weight: 2.82 pounds (1.28 kg)

Today's Best Deals

【72†View at Amazon†target.georiot.com】

【73†View at ASUS†www.awin1.com】

【74†View at Best Buy†shop-links.co】

#### Reasons to buy

+

Thin and light build

+

Good price for 32GB of RAM and 1TB of storage

+

Fast, bursty performance

+

Colorful screen 

#### Reasons to avoid

-

Throttled during stress testing

-

Mushy keyboard 

It's easy to impress us with a great screen or fast performance, and the Asus Zenbook 14 OLED delivers both. But where it really shows off is its price. You get an Intel Core Ultra 7 155H, 32GB of RAM and 1TB of storage for $1,299 as of this writing. Many other companies would charge you hundreds of dollars more.  

Beyond those specs, you get a light laptop at just 2.82 pounds (1.28 kg) that feels pretty sturdy, though the "ponder blue" metal body is a bit of a fingerprint magnet. 

We found that Asus' laptop offered fast, bursty performance, hitting a single-core score of 1,809 and a multi-core score of 10,962 on Geekbench 5. But when we stress tested the laptop with Cinebench, we found that the chip throttled in continuous testing. So the laptop is fine for bursts of speed, but not for long-term heavy workloads.

The keyboard is a bit mushy for our liking, but otherwise, you're getting pretty high level specs for that $1,299 price tag. Other laptop companies should take note on the pricing.

Read: 【71†Asus Zenbook 14 OLED (UX3405M) review】 

* * *

[Image 12: Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon (Gen 11)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

### 【75†6. Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carb

metadata.title: 8 Best 32GB RAM Laptop with Dedicated GPU in 2024
metadata.text:
Its nearest competitors didn’t crack 300 nits. It’s fair to conclude, after almost 22 years in the market, that ASUS knows how to build a laptop for gaming. The manufacturer always decides whether to do a complete overhaul or when to do some changes and refine the product as a whole.

Performance Under Workload 

The ASUS ROG Strix Scar 15 Gaming laptop version is the first in the series to rock Intel’s latest 5.0-GHz, 12th Gen Core i9-12900H CPU with a whopping 32 GB RAM.

And thanks to the ASUS Command Center, this beast can be overclocked to a blazing 6 GHz. When it comes to multitasking it is sort of like a modern Ivan Drago.

We started streaming Runaways on Hulu when watching some of our favorite videos on YouTube about the Steven Universe hypothesis. We just kept opening tabs in Google Chrome from there, some running Slack, some running Twitch, until we got 35 tabs free.

Then We run Windows Protector and out of this thing, there was nary a hiccup. However, all of our tests didn’t automatically turn that strength into stellar performance.

For example, it kept its own but it did not blow the rivalry away. This unit on Geekbench 4 delivered 20,890 which measures overall performance. That beats the average 17,290 luxury gaming laptops but the Titan and Aorus produced 22,754 and 25,915, respectively, equipped with their own 8950HKs.

The Eon17-X reached 21,713, with its Intel Core i9-12900H CPU laptop. The ASUS ROG Strix Scar 15 paired up 65,000 names and addresses in 42 seconds during our Excel usability check, slipping past the typical 0:44 level. The Titan and Aorus X9 posted 0:34 and 0:31 quicker speeds, respectively.

## 2. MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop

“Full-Fledged Gaming Beast & Video Editing Workstation in Reasonable Price”

  * Display: 16″ QHD+, 3840 x 2160, Anti-glare, 4K
  * Processor: Intel Core i9-11900H, 4.6GHz, 8 Cores
  * Graphics Card:  NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 8GB, GDDR6
  * RAM & Storage: 32GB DDR4, 2TB NVMe SSD
  * Operating System: Windows 10 Pro

Pros

  * Solid Performance
  * Can be Used for Gaming
  * Portable Design
  * Built for Intensive Work 

Cons

  * Speakers are Average 
  * Starting Price is High 

Design

The MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop is made out of aluminum with a silver finish, good thing is that at least we don’t have to worry about it being made of plastic. However, when adding some weight to the center of the keyboard its lightweight produces some visible flex.

Also when you push the corners of the screen and area around the power button, the same flex happens. A security lock slot, two Type-A USB 3.1 ports an Ethernet port, and separate jack for headphones and microphones are included in the connectivity options of MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop gaming laptop.

You will find a display outputs for mini DisplayPort and HDMI, an external USB-A port, an AC adapter connector and a Thunderbolt 3 port on the right side of this gaming rig.

Display 

The MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop offers a 4K 3840 x 2160 resolution eye-friendly display, the screen is non-touch. Though as games do, productivity and innovation Applications will not going to exploit their high refresh rate.

All of the images look incredibly sharp on this display. backed by wide viewing angles and inky blacks set on pristine white backgrounds, the level of brightness and contrast is more than enough.

Even though the matte finish of the screen minimizes screen glare but at the same time, the colors look faded. Ultimately, for long work sessions, this screen will appear to be a good place. So overall the display of MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop is great especially if you are interested in playing triple AAA games. 

Performance Under Workload 

The MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop is as powerful as it comes in performance with the new 【71†Intel Core i9-11900H CPU†ark.intel.com】, 32 GB RAM, 2TB NVMe SSD, and 【72†Nvidia GeForce RTX 3060†www.nvidia.com】 graphics card.

Good thing is that this configuration is the same as compared to gaming laptops. This simply means for the vast majority of things as a content creator you can throw at it, this machine is capable enough to cope up well with them all as its name suggests.

This laptop easily edits a 4 K video without slowing down throughout the whole process during our test and it takes a matter of seconds to render the edited video at the tail end.

To be honest, that kind of performance level you only get from a pro-machine built for content creation and editing. So if you require a laptop for video editing and content creation then consider MSI P65 your best option under the budget of $2500.

“Full HD, Intel 12th Gen Gaming & Perform

The fanless design is totally silent, but it also means the M3 chip isn't actively cooled. That means yes, the chip will throttle for intense work like video editing and rendering. (In our testing, we found the 13-inch laptop throttled faster possibly because the 15-inch Air has more surface area to cool the chip). But for most tasks, like email, documents, and spreadsheets, you shouldn't have any worries.

### 【66†4. MacBook Pro (16-inch)】

A Powerful Mac Option

【66†Our expert review:】

#### Specifications

GPU: 40-core (Apple M3 Max integrated)

Today's Best Deals

#### Reasons to buy

+

M3 Max offers powerful performance

+

Long battery life

+

Great build quality

+

Excellent Mini-LED display 

#### Reasons to avoid

-

Memory and SSD upgrades are extremely pricey 

Apple's MacBook Pros on Apple Silicon haven't changed much in design, except now they come in Space Black. (And Space Black looks great!). Apple's latest changes are still on the inside, with its latest M3 Pro and M3 Max chips.  

We tested the 16-inch MacBook Pro with an M3 Max and were impressed by its battery life: 17 hours and 11 minutes on our battery test, even while powering a vivid Mini-LED screen. The chip is efficient.

This latest MacBook Pros retain the wide variety of ports, including HDMI and an SD card slot, that we loved last year, as well as a bright, vivid Mini-LED display.

While the design hasn't changed, that means you also get excellent speakers and a comfortable keyboard with full-size function keys. But it also means that there's still a notch in the display to hold the 1080p webcam, which some might find to be distracting.

For those who need more graphics power, you may want to step up to the M3 Max, goes up to 40 graphics cores. If you want more battery life, the 16-inch MacBook Pro has a larger battery (100 WHr vs the 14-incher MacBook Pro's 72.4 WHr), and endured.   

If you prefer a smaller screen, you may want to consider the 14-inch Macbook Pro, which also comes with your choice of M3 Pro or M3 Max. We haven't had the chance to test the new entry level MacBook Pro — a 14-incher with a regular M3 and fewer ports — but that one is expensive for the amount of RAM you get in it, and with upgrades benign so pricey, you may want to start with the more powerful options anyway.

Read: 【66†MacBook Pro (16-inch) Review】

* * *

[Image 11: Asus Zenbook 14 OLED]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

### 【71†5. Asus Zenbook 14 OLED】

Good price for high specs

【71†Our expert review:】

#### Specifications 

CPU: Intel Core Ultra 7 155H 

GPU: Intel Arc integrated Graphics 

Display: 14-inch, 2880 x 1800, 16:10, OLED touchscreen 

Weight: 2.82 pounds (1.28 kg)

Today's Best Deals

【72†View at Amazon†target.georiot.com】

【73†View at ASUS†www.awin1.com】

【74†View at Best Buy†shop-links.co】

#### Reasons to buy

+

Thin and light build

+

Good price for 32GB of RAM and 1TB of storage

+

Fast, bursty performance

+

Colorful screen 

#### Reasons to avoid

-

Throttled during stress testing

-

Mushy keyboard 

It's easy to impress us with a great screen or fast performance, and the Asus Zenbook 14 OLED delivers both. But where it really shows off is its price. You get an Intel Core Ultra 7 155H, 32GB of RAM and 1TB of storage for $1,299 as of this writing. Many other companies would charge you hundreds of dollars more.  

Beyond those specs, you get a light laptop at just 2.82 pounds (1.28 kg) that feels pretty sturdy, though the "ponder blue" metal body is a bit of a fingerprint magnet. 

We found that Asus' laptop offered fast, bursty performance, hitting a single-core score of 1,809 and a multi-core score of 10,962 on Geekbench 5. But when we stress tested the laptop with Cinebench, we found that the chip throttled in continuous testing. So the laptop is fine for bursts of speed, but not for long-term heavy workloads.

The keyboard is a bit mushy for our liking, but otherwise, you're getting pretty high level specs for that $1,299 price tag. Other laptop companies should take note on the pricing.

Read: 【71†Asus Zenbook 14 OLED (UX3405M) review】

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

content_references.title: 8 Best 32GB RAM Laptop with Dedicated GPU in 2024
content_references.snippet:
Its nearest competitors didn’t crack 300 nits. It’s fair to conclude, after almost 22 years in the market, that ASUS knows how to build a laptop for gaming. The manufacturer always decides whether to do a complete overhaul or when to do some changes and refine the product as a whole.

Performance Under Workload 

The ASUS ROG Strix Scar 15 Gaming laptop version is the first in the series to rock Intel’s latest 5.0-GHz, 12th Gen Core i9-12900H CPU with a whopping 32 GB RAM.

And thanks to the ASUS Command Center, this beast can be overclocked to a blazing 6 GHz. When it comes to multitasking it is sort of like a modern Ivan Drago.

We started streaming Runaways on Hulu when watching some of our favorite videos on YouTube about the Steven Universe hypothesis. We just kept opening tabs in Google Chrome from there, some running Slack, some running Twitch, until we got 35 tabs free.

Then We run Windows Protector and out of this thing, there was nary a hiccup. However, all of our tests didn’t automatically turn that strength into stellar performance.

For example, it kept its own but it did not blow the rivalry away. This unit on Geekbench 4 delivered 20,890 which measures overall performance. That beats the average 17,290 luxury gaming laptops but the Titan and Aorus produced 22,754 and 25,915, respectively, equipped with their own 8950HKs.

The Eon17-X reached 21,713, with its Intel Core i9-12900H CPU laptop. The ASUS ROG Strix Scar 15 paired up 65,000 names and addresses in 42 seconds during our Excel usability check, slipping past the typical 0:44 level. The Titan and Aorus X9 posted 0:34 and 0:31 quicker speeds, respectively. 

【69† BUY NOW ON AMAZON†www.amazon.com】 

Go to top

## 2. MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop

“Full-Fledged Gaming Beast & Video Editing Workstation in Reasonable Price” 

【70† †www.amazon.com】 

【70† MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop: 16" QHD+ 16:10 120Hz... †www.amazon.com】 

  * Display: 16″ QHD+, 3840 x 2160, Anti-glare, 4K
  * Processor: Intel Core i9-11900H, 4.6GHz, 8 Cores
  * Graphics Card:  NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, 8GB, GDDR6
  * RAM & Storage: 32GB DDR4, 2TB NVMe SSD
  * Operating System: Windows 10 Pro

【70†CHECK ON AMAZON†www.amazon.com】 

Pros

  * Solid Performance
  * Can be Used for Gaming
  * Portable Design
  * Built for Intensive Work 

Cons

  * Speakers are Average 
  * Starting Price is High 

Design

The MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop is made out of aluminum with a silver finish, good thing is that at least we don’t have to worry about it being made of plastic. However, when adding some weight to the center of the keyboard its lightweight produces some visible flex.

Also when you push the corners of the screen and area around the power button, the same flex happens. A security lock slot, two Type-A USB 3.1 ports an Ethernet port, and separate jack for headphones and microphones are included in the connectivity options of MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop gaming laptop.

You will find a display outputs for mini DisplayPort and HDMI, an external USB-A port, an AC adapter connector and a Thunderbolt 3 port on the right side of this gaming rig.

Display 

The MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop offers a 4K 3840 x 2160 resolution eye-friendly display, the screen is non-touch. Though as games do, productivity and innovation Applications will not going to exploit their high refresh rate.

All of the images look incredibly sharp on this display. backed by wide viewing angles and inky blacks set on pristine white backgrounds, the level of brightness and contrast is more than enough.

Even though the matte finish of the screen minimizes screen glare but at the same time, the colors look faded. Ultimately, for long work sessions, this screen will appear to be a good place. So overall the display of MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop is great especially if you are interested in playing triple AAA games. 

Performance Under Workload 

The MSI Creator Z16 Professional Laptop is as powerful as it comes in performance with the new 【71†Intel Core i9-11900H CPU†ark.intel.com】, 32 GB RAM, 2TB NVMe SSD, and 【72†Nvidia GeForce RTX 3060†www.nvidia.com】 graphics card.

Good thing is that this configuration is the same as compared to gaming laptops. This simply means for the vast majority of things as a content creator you can throw at it, this machine is capable enough to cope up well with them all as its name suggests.

This laptop easily edits a 4 K video without slowing down throughout the whole process during our test and it takes a matter of seconds to render the edited video at the tail end.

To be honest, that kind of performance level you only get from a pro-machine built for content creation and editing. So if you require a laptop for video editing and content creation then consider MSI P65 your best option under the budget of $2500.

【73† BUY NOW ON AMAZON†www.amazon.com】 

Go to top

“Full HD, Intel 12th Gen Gaming & Perform

#### Reasons to avoid

Lenovo's legacy of supplying incredible ThinkPads to the business sector is back to its dizzying heights. The X1 Carbon, now in its 11th generation, is a true return to form for the 【72†ThinkPad】, solving the battery life woes of the previous model and supplying all the power and performance you'd expect to accompany the ThinkPad name.

It topped premium average scores throughout our benchmark trials. That performance comes from a 13th-generation Intel Core i7 processor backed by Iris Xe graphics, 16GB of RAM, and 512GB of speedy SSD storage.

On the Geekbench 5.5 overall performance test, the ThinkPad X1 Carbon (Gen 11) managed a multi-core score of 8,628, solid enough to handle a moderate workload but certainly not the best you can find today. At the very least, its SSD speeds are phenomenal, managing to duplicate 25GB of multimedia files in 16 seconds for a rate of 1,704 megabytes per second.

Best of all, you're getting exceptional longevity. On the Laptop Mag battery test, which consists of surfing the web over Wi-Fi at 150 nits, it lasted 13 hours and 45 minutes. Considering the average is around 10 hours and 30 minutes, this is pretty exceptional.

Perhaps most impressive is how the X1 Carbon managed to squeeze all of this into a body that weighs just 2.5 pounds without sacrificing anything of its excellent keyboard or bright 14-inch display.

See our full 【71†Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon Gen 11 review.】

Back to the top

Plain and simple, the 【75†Razer】 Blade 14 is the 【76†best gaming laptop】 I've reviewed. There's no beating around the bush in that this isn't a cheap product, coming in at over $2,000, but there's no world in which it could disappoint with its stunning display, long-lasting battery life, and powerful RTX 4070 gaming performance.

The model we reviewed is built with an AMD Ryzen 9 7940HS processor, Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 graphics card, 16GB of RAM, and 1TB of SSD storage. Its 14-inch, 2560 x 1440-pixel display at 240Hz refresh rate is excellent on paper and fantastic in practice. Its 114.3 percent reproduction of the DCI-P3 color gamut is phenomenal, soaring far beyond the premium gaming laptop average of 93 percent. 

We recommend anything between 80 and 100 percent, but going over 100 percent is even better. Its brightness is also nothing to scoff at, hitting 465 nits on average. This demolishes the category average of 408 nits, meaning you'll easily carry it outdoors, even in intense sunlight, without worrying about glare.

But its display isn't the only thing that gives it top marks and makes it our best gaming laptop. Its productivity performance is thanks to its AMD Ryzen 9 7940HS processor. The Geekbench 5.5 overall

The all-new 14.5-inch 2.8K 120 Hz OLED NanoEdge display produces jaw-dropping detail, ultra-vivid colors and a cinema-grade 100% DCI-P3 color gamut. Creating or enjoying visual content with bright and clear HDR images, along with the deepest blacks.

content.text:
(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 26: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 27: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

On the Shadow of the Tomb Raider benchmark (highest settings), the Blade won out at 1080p, running the test at 121 fps. The Alienware took second place at 113 fps, while the Zephyrus fell behind at 100 fps. The Blade and Alienware had very similar scores at 2560 x 1600.

Cyberpunk 2077 on the ray tracing ultra preset was a closer test. The Blade 14 hit 42 fps at 1080p and 42 fps at 2560 x 1600. The difference between it and the Alienware is minimal. The Zephyrus hit 39 fps at 1080p, which isn't as big a gap as we see in some other games.

Far Cry 6 (ultra) showed the Alienware (89 fps) just beat the Blade 14, which ran the benchmark at 86 fps at 1080p. Both hit the same 71 fps at native resolution. Meanwhile, the Asus ROG Zephyrus G14 fell down to 77 fps.

On Red Dead Redemption 2 (medium settings), the Razer Blade hit 73 fps at 1080p, besting the Zephyrus (67 fps) and the Alienware, which fell to a rare third place for FHD.

The AMD-based laptops showed strength on Borderlands 3 (badass preset), with the Blade hitting 108 fps at 1080p and the Zephyrus coming in second at 86 fps. The Intel-based rigs shared similar numbers in the 60s at FHD.

We stress-tested the Blade with Metro Exodus, running the game's benchmark 15 times in a loop on the RTX preset. The system ran the benchmark at an average of 81.53 fps, which was fairly consistent across the runs. The CPU ran at an average of 3.68 GHz and measured 56 degrees Celsius. The GPU averaged 916.57 MHz and ran at 55 degrees C.

## Productivity Performance on the Razer Blade 14 

The Razer Blade 14 we tested came with an AMD Ryzen 9 8945HS, 32GB of RAM, a 1TB M.2 【69†PCIe】 SSD, and an Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 Laptop GPU. For most non-gaming tasks, this should be plenty.

Image 1 of 3

[Image 28: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 29: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 30: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

On Geekbench 6, the Razer Blade 14 was the best of our test group with a single-core score of 2,684 and a multi-core score of 13,781. The ROG Zephyrus G14, with the same CPU, scored lower, but still came out ahead of the systems with Intel CPUs. The Alienware m16 R2 and HP Omen Transcend 14, each with an Intel Core Ultra 7 155H, fell to the bottom of the chart.

The Blade copied 25GB of files at a rate of 1,951.61 MBps, surpassing the Omen (1,829.51 MBps) and the Zephyrus (the slowest, at 1,352.76 MBps). The Alienware was the fastest of the bunch at 2,014.58 MBps.

On Handbrake, Razer's laptop transcoded a 【70†4K】 video to 1080p in 4 minutes and 1 second, coming ahead of the Zephyrus and Omen but behind the Alienware.

## Display on the Razer Blade 14 

Razer's 14-inch, 2560 x 1600 display is bright and reasonably colorful and runs as fast as 240 Hz for quick-twitch esports.

I was using the Blade when the trailer for Joker: Folie à Deux dropped. While it's not 【71†OLED】 or even micro LED it showed off the trailer well. One scene in which the Joker and Harley Queen dance under the moon was an appropriate shade of blue, which contrasted greatly with a similar scene in which they're in front of a large orange fire. 

Similarly, the screen made Alan Wake 2 look good, showing off the daylight town of Bright Falls and a dark horror scene taking place inside a police morgue with equal detail. Lighting from a flashlight on Saga Anderson's face was eerie.

[Image 31: Razer Blad

If you're looking for a laptop that's portable enough to take anywhere, but powerful enough to get work done on the go, you've come to the right place. These laptops are perfect for students, professionals, and business people. Browse the top-ranked list of 14-inch laptops for sale below along with associated reviews and opinions.

### 【752†ASUS - ROG Zephyrus G14 14" OLED 3K 120Hz Gaming Laptop - AMD Ryzen 9 8945HS - 32GB LPDDR5X - NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 - 1TB SSD - Platinum White】

Model: GA403UI-G14.R94070 

SKU: 6570271

【753†Rating 4.7 out of 5 stars with 120 reviews (120 reviews)】

Top comment

"This is the laptop to beat! I sold my MacBook Pro and bought this laptop and I’m not going back any time soon...The common challanege of 14 inch is the heat issue but ASUS seemed to handle it well on the new chassis....Hands down the best performer of 14 inch...Best 14 inch Laptop"

【753†See all customer reviews】

#### Product Description 

The ROG Zephyrus G14 has been redesigned with an all-new premium aluminum chassis for increased durability and elegance. At 0.63 inches thin and weighing in at just 3.31lbs, this gaming powerhouse combines portability with cutting-edge technology. Featuring Windows 11 and an NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4070 GPU, the Zephyrus G14 achieves unparalleled gaming performance. The AMD Ryzen 9 8945HS processor further enhances productivity with 16 TOPS in AI Performance. The Zephyrus G14 features an OLED ROG Nebula Display. metadata.title: Razer Blade 14 (2024) review: Small frame, full power, high price | Tom's Hardware
metadata.text:
(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 26: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 27: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

On the Shadow of the Tomb Raider benchmark (highest settings), the Blade won out at 1080p, running the test at 121 fps. The Alienware took second place at 113 fps, while the Zephyrus fell behind at 100 fps. The Blade and Alienware had very similar scores at 2560 x 1600.

Cyberpunk 2077 on the ray tracing ultra preset was a closer test. The Blade 14 hit 42 fps at 1080p and 42 fps at 2560 x 1600. The difference between it and the Alienware is minimal. The Zephyrus hit 39 fps at 1080p, which isn't as big a gap as we see in some other games.

Far Cry 6 (ultra) showed the Alienware (89 fps) just beat the Blade 14, which ran the benchmark at 86 fps at 1080p. Both hit the same 71 fps at native resolution. Meanwhile, the Asus ROG Zephyrus G14 fell down to 77 fps.

On Red Dead Redemption 2 (medium settings), the Razer Blade hit 73 fps at 1080p, besting the Zephyrus (67 fps) and the Alienware, which fell to a rare third place for FHD.

The AMD-based laptops showed strength on Borderlands 3 (badass preset), with the Blade hitting 108 fps at 1080p and the Zephyrus coming in second at 86 fps. The Intel-based rigs shared similar numbers in the 60s at FHD.

We stress-tested the Blade with Metro Exodus, running the game's benchmark 15 times in a loop on the RTX preset. The system ran the benchmark at an average of 81.53 fps, which was fairly consistent across the runs. The CPU ran at an average of 3.68 GHz and measured 56 degrees Celsius. The GPU averaged 916.57 MHz and ran at 55 degrees C.

## Productivity Performance on the Razer Blade 14 

The Razer Blade 14 we tested came with an AMD Ryzen 9 8945HS, 32GB of RAM, a 1TB M.2 【69†PCIe】 SSD, and an Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 Laptop GPU. For most non-gaming tasks, this should be plenty.

Image 1 of 3

[Image 28: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 29: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 30: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

On Geekbench 6, the Razer Blade 14 was the best of our test group with a single-core score of 2,684 and a multi-core score of 13,781. The ROG Zephyrus G14, with the same CPU, scored lower, but still came out ahead of the systems with Intel CPUs. The Alienware m16 R2 and HP Omen Transcend 14, each with an Intel Core Ultra 7 155H, fell to the bottom of the chart.

The Blade copied 25GB of files at a rate of 1,951.61 MBps, surpassing the Omen (1,829.51 MBps) and the Zephyrus (the slowest, at 1,352.76 MBps). The Alienware was the fastest of the bunch at 2,014.58 MBps.

On Handbrake, Razer's laptop transcoded a 【70†4K】 video to 1080p in 4 minutes and 1 second, coming ahead of the Zephyrus and Omen but behind the Alienware.

## Display on the Razer Blade 14 

Razer's 14-inch, 2560 x 1600 display is bright and reasonably colorful and runs as fast as 240 Hz for quick-twitch esports.

I was using the Blade when the trailer for Joker: Folie à Deux dropped. While it's not 【71†OLED】 or even micro LED it showed off the trailer well. One scene in which the Joker and Harley Queen dance under the moon was an appropriate shade of blue, which contrasted greatly with a similar scene in which they're in front of a large orange fire. 

Similarly, the screen made Alan Wake 2 look good, showing off the daylight town of Bright Falls and a dark horror scene taking place inside a police morgue with equal detail. Lighting from a flashlight on Saga Anderson's face was eerie.

[Image 31: Razer Blad

content_references.title: Razer Blade 14 (2024) review: Small frame, full power, high price | Tom's Hardware
content_references.snippet:
(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 26: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 27: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

On the Shadow of the Tomb Raider benchmark (highest settings), the Blade won out at 1080p, running the test at 121 fps. The Alienware took second place at 113 fps, while the Zephyrus fell behind at 100 fps. The Blade and Alienware had very similar scores at 2560 x 1600.

Cyberpunk 2077 on the ray tracing ultra preset was a closer test. The Blade 14 hit 42 fps at 1080p and 42 fps at 2560 x 1600. The difference between it and the Alienware is minimal. The Zephyrus hit 39 fps at 1080p, which isn't as big a gap as we see in some other games.

Far Cry 6 (ultra) showed the Alienware (89 fps) just beat the Blade 14, which ran the benchmark at 86 fps at 1080p. Both hit the same 71 fps at native resolution. Meanwhile, the Asus ROG Zephyrus G14 fell down to 77 fps.

On Red Dead Redemption 2 (medium settings), the Razer Blade hit 73 fps at 1080p, besting the Zephyrus (67 fps) and the Alienware, which fell to a rare third place for FHD.

The AMD-based laptops showed strength on Borderlands 3 (badass preset), with the Blade hitting 108 fps at 1080p and the Zephyrus coming in second at 86 fps. The Intel-based rigs shared similar numbers in the 60s at FHD.

We stress-tested the Blade with Metro Exodus, running the game's benchmark 15 times in a loop on the RTX preset. The system ran the benchmark at an average of 81.53 fps, which was fairly consistent across the runs. The CPU ran at an average of 3.68 GHz and measured 56 degrees Celsius. The GPU averaged 916.57 MHz and ran at 55 degrees C.

## Productivity Performance on the Razer Blade 14 

The Razer Blade 14 we tested came with an AMD Ryzen 9 8945HS, 32GB of RAM, a 1TB M.2 【69†PCIe】 SSD, and an Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 Laptop GPU. For most non-gaming tasks, this should be plenty.

Image 1 of 3

[Image 28: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 29: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

[Image 30: Razer Blade 14 (2024)]

(Image credit: Tom's Hardware)

On Geekbench 6, the Razer Blade 14 was the best of our test group with a single-core score of 2,684 and a multi-core score of 13,781. The ROG Zephyrus G14, with the same CPU, scored lower, but still came out ahead of the systems with Intel CPUs. The Alienware m16 R2 and HP Omen Transcend 14, each with an Intel Core Ultra 7 155H, fell to the bottom of the chart.

The Blade copied 25GB of files at a rate of 1,951.61 MBps, surpassing the Omen (1,829.51 MBps) and the Zephyrus (the slowest, at 1,352.76 MBps). The Alienware was the fastest of the bunch at 2,014.58 MBps.

On Handbrake, Razer's laptop transcoded a 【70†4K】 video to 1080p in 4 minutes and 1 second, coming ahead of the Zephyrus and Omen but behind the Alienware.

## Display on the Razer Blade 14 

Razer's 14-inch, 2560 x 1600 display is bright and reasonably colorful and runs as fast as 240 Hz for quick-twitch esports.

I was using the Blade when the trailer for Joker: Folie à Deux dropped. While it's not 【71†OLED】 or even micro LED it showed off the trailer well. One scene in which the Joker and Harley Queen dance under the moon was an appropriate shade of blue, which contrasted greatly with a similar scene in which they're in front of a large orange fire. 

Similarly, the screen made Alan Wake 2 look good, showing off the daylight town of Bright Falls and a dark horror scene taking place inside a police morgue with equal detail. Lighting from a flashlight on Saga Anderson's face was eerie.

[Image 31: Razer Blad

Model:GU603ZM-M16.I73060 

SKU:6494642 

This item is no longer available in new condition.

See similar items below.

No content 

Overview

### Description 

Dive headfirst into one of the best gaming laptop experiences on Windows 11. The ROG Zephyrus M16 packs a 14-core Intel Core i7-12700H CPU and NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 GPU into a super thin gaming laptop. Enjoy a fast 165Hz refresh rate, 16GB of RAM, and 512GB of PCIe 4.0 SSD storage all wrapped in a light 4.41 lbs chassis. The future is thin and light.

### Features

  * [Image 17: Intel 12th Generation Core i7]
  * [Image 18: Windows 11 Home]

  * #### Windows 11 Operating System 

Family, friends, passions, music, creations, games – Windows 11 is the one place for it all. With a fresh new feel and tools that make it easier to be efficient, it has what you need for whatever’s next.

  * #### 12th Generation Intel Core i7-12700H 

Power your games with the latest Alder Lake Intel Core i7-12700H CPU. 14 cores and 20 threads are ready to handle the latest AAA games.

  * #### NVIDIA RTX 3060 6GB GDDR6 Graphics 

NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 6GB GDDR6 with ROG Boost at 100W (120W with Dynamic Boost 2.0) for an ultrafast GPU to fuel your games.

  * #### 16" FHD display with 165Hz refresh rate 

The 165Hz ultra bright 500 nits display features a 16:10 1920x1200 resolution that gives you more space for toolbars and tabs. Don't worry about ghosting with the 3ms response time.

  * #### 16GB of next generation, dual-channel, DDR5 4800Mhz system memory 

16GB (8GB + 8GB) of dual-channel memory significantly increases performance, compared to single-channel, and the blazing fast 4800MHz DDR5 next generation memory standard allows the Zephyrus M16 to multitask with ease.

  * #### 512GB Solid State Drive (PCIe Gen4)

Save files fast and store more data and games. With massive amounts of storage and advanced communication power, PCIe SSDs are great for major gaming applications, multiple servers, daily backups, and more.

  * #### Your choice of Nvidia Optimus or MUX switch for direct GPU mode 

NVIDIA Optimus technology intelligently optimizes your notebook PC, while extending battery life for longer enjoyment.

  * #### Weighs 4.41 lbs and Measures 0.78" Thin 

The M16 is a true featherweight for its class, weighing in at just 4.41 lbs and only 0.78" thin. This extremely lightweight chassis means the M16 is exceptionally portable, fitting in even small bags and carrying cases.

  * #### Robust Connectivity with Thunderbolt 4 

ROG Zephyrus M16 is ripe with connectivity. With a dedicated USB Type-C with Thunderbolt™ 4 support, one USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-C port, two USB 3.2 Gen 2 Type-A ports, and an RJ45 LAN port, the machine has excellent options even
